Reliance Industries Ltd.’s operating income is expected to double in the next three years, global brokerage house Goldman Sachs said in its research report.The Mukesh Ambani-led company is likely to report operating income, or the earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortisation of $14 billion in the financial year ending March 2020, compared to $7 billion reported in the financial year-ended March 2017, the report said.The research company expects that petrochemical segment will be the key driver of growth over the medium term, while the refining earnings would remain stable. “(Reliance) Jio, which will start contributing from the next financial year, will be key for earnings growth beyond March 2020,” it added.

Reliance Industries  provides the best large-cap downstream energy exposure in Asia, in our view, with sector-leading earnings growth and strong competitive positioning.Goldman Sachs Research Report






“With capex intensity declining, we expect free cash flow to turn positive after five years with a yield of 6 percent in the next financial year,” Goldman Sachs said.

The brokerage house also hiked the target price to Rs 1,205 from Rs 920.85, implying a potential upside of 30.9 percent from yesterday's closing price and added the company to its Conviction List.“Volume-led growth with capex cycle completion, refining margins to outperform peers and telecom business to start contributing positively are the key positives,” Goldman said.

title: Reliance Industries’ Operating Income To Double In Three Years, Says Goldman Sachs
